crisisMode.title: QuantumPay Crisis Mode
crisisMode.subtitle: A resilient payment network designed for uncertain times.
crisisMode.intro: QuantumPay is built with the assumption that global systems can fail â€” power outages, internet disruptions, or cyber incidents. Crisis Mode defines how the network continues to operate and how users stay protected.

pillars.decentralization: Decentralized validation across independent nodes in multiple regions.
pillars.selfCustody: Users remain in control of their assets at all times.
pillars.offlineReady: Designed to support delayed settlement and offline-first recovery scenarios.
pillars.transparency: All critical data remains verifiable on-chain.

whatHappens: Network prioritizes block finality and data integrity.
Temporary delays may occur, but balances remain safe.
No central authority can freeze or confiscate funds.
crisisMode.closing: Crisis Mode is not an emergency feature. It is the default assumption of QuantumPay.
